pull.title: IsUsedDestination should count any known single-key address
pull.body: This plugs the privacy leak detailed at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/17605, at least for the single-key case.

events.body: cc @kallewoof since you designed the first iteration
Concept ACK on patching this in the interim before descriptor wallets arrive. Edit: Code review, built, ran tests, tested manually.

Pushed test, updated logic to fix test failure.

Removed a function that resulted in a used footgun.

ACK 9f7eea56f2b0fbc128b83fccab344190b1e6ce54

Reviewed code and tested locally.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17889](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17889.html) (wallet: Improve CWallet:MarkDestinationsDirty by promag)
* [#17843](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17843.html) (wallet: Reset reused transactions cache by fjahr)
* [#17838](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17838.html) (test: test the >10 UTXO case for output groups by kallewoof)
* [#17824](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17824.html) (wallet: Improve coin selection for destination groups >10 by fjahr)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

events.message: IsUsedDestination should count any known single-key address

comments.body: nit, also add the EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED annotation.
Haven't profiled but looks like `GetDestData && IsMine` should be faster?
d'oh, I always have to sit there and reason with myself on this :)
I just got rid of the `IsMine` check. If a record for `used` exists in the wallet we should trust it.
The annotation is supposed to go in the header file.
is it just a no-op here? I am not a clang wizard.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -193,7 +198,7 @@ def test_fund_send_fund_send(self):
         '''
         self.log.info("Test fund send fund send")
 
-        fundaddr = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress()
+        fundaddr = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress(label="", address_type="legacy")

comments.body: `Attributes must be attached to named declarations` oooohkay fixed

From [clang docs](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ThreadSafetyAnalysis.html#frequently-asked-questions):

> Attributes are part of the formal interface of a function, and should always go in the header, where they are visible to anything that includes the header. Attributes in the .cpp file are not visible outside of the immediate translation unit, which leads to false negatives and false positives.

comments.body: It would be, once address type default is changed, no?
nit, you could move this line after L2932 - no point in calling `IsUsedDestination` if this address doesn't matter.
